description.narrative: The initiation plan aims to promote Government leadership, advance inter and intra-institutional coordination and build institutional capacity to successfully implement Tunisia’s NDC as part of support to the Paris Agreement

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of sectoral consultative workshops held to develop NDC Partnership Plan and reported in media 1.2 Number of institutions participating in workshops, with targets for women and youth 1.3 Existence of a coordination mechanism between key stakeholders including Implementing Partners (IP) to track NDC Partnership Plan implementation 1.4 Number of inclusive NDC Partnership Plans endorsed 1.5 Number of high-level conferences organized to adopt NDC Partnership Plan and promote ambition 1.6 Number and types of communications and advocacy materials prepared on the Tunisian experience related to NDC implementation process and reach. 2.1 Number of trainings held to capacitate national experts on methods/tools to integrate the NDC targets and gender dimensions into development planning and to monitor NDC implementation and positively assessed by participants 2.2 Number of institutions trained, including gender targets for trainees 2.3 Number of sectoral action plans to integrate NDC targets and gender into development planning and monitor progress 3.1 Number of key stakeholders trained on specific issues of climate negotiation 3.2 Number of key stakeholders participated to high level conference and workshops to communicate on Tunisia experience on climate change.

comment.narrative: 1. 1 et 1.2 Consultation process to discuss NDC implementation road map has been launched in 2017 (70 participants at launch) 1.3 No coordination mechanism exists explicitly related to NDC implementation 1.4 0 1.5 Participation of Tunisia to UNDP/NDC P side event at COP24 to present the process around NDC implementation plan design 1.6 Case study in NDC Partnership in action document 2.1 120 technical staff are trained on priority themes related to climate change issues among them at least 40% women. 2.2 0 2.3 0 3.1 0 3.2 0

1.1. A partnership plan developed according to NDC Partnership Template and approved 1.2. A national forum on financing the energy transition including the role of the private sector is organized 1.3. 20 parliamentarians / advisers benefiting from the information / advocacy and capacity building program on climate change 1.4. Communication tools developed to document and share the Tunisian experience in implementing the NDC
2.1.1. A study on gender mainstreaming in CC policies including the NDC deveopppeld 2.1.2. 10 institutions benefiting from the sectoral and local capacity building plan on gender and climate change 2.2.3. A Guidance note for mainstreaming gender and climate change in development planning processes in support of work on SDG 13 elaborated 2.2.1 25 of non-state actors and local authorities contributing to the dialogue 2.2.2. A concerted charter on the role of local authorities and non-state actors in the implementation of the Paris Agreement is developped 3.1. 7 representatives of stakeholders involved in the NDC implementation process participating in high-level conferences and communicating on Tunisias experience with climate change

- A partnership plan developed according to NDC Partnership Template - Printing and sharing with the Assembly of Peoples Representatives of three main documents on climate action for dissemination to parliamentarians: the CDN, the third national communication on climate change and the policy note on low carbon development in Tunisia . - Development of 4 communication supports to document and share the Tunisian experience in the implementation of the NDC: * Two 2D videos (in French and in English) on climate issues in Tunisia and the national policy to fight climate change and support needs. * A documentary video on the NDC in Tunisia and the roadmap for the implementation of the NDC * 10 stakeholder testimony videos on na CDN in Tunisia and the roadmap - Preparation and translation into French and English of a policy brief document entitled Tunisia in action for low carbon and resilient development by 2050 - ToRs of study on gender integration prepared and procurement processs launched - ToRs of training program for parliamentarians / advisers prepared

1.1 - Number of roadmap for the NDC implementation developed 1.2- A Partnership Plan for the NDC implementation elaborated 1.4 - Parliamentarians / parliamentary advisers benefiting from the information and capacity-building program 1.5 Number and types of communications and advocacy materials prepared on the Tunisian experience related to NDC implementation process and reach. 3.2 - Number of key stakeholders participated to high level conference and workshops to communicate on Tunisia experience on climate change.

1.1 - A roadmap of NDC implementation was finished following a large consultative process started since 2017. It was presented and discussed in June 2019 to the nationals’ stakeholders already involved in the elaboration process. A final version was elaborated taking into consideration recommendations from the meeting. and it was adopted by the Ministry of Local Affairs and Enviormentr. A summary of the This roadmap was prepared and translated to English.
The Road map was presented and discussed with technical and financial partners during a workshop with the participation of representatives from NDC Partnership and UNDP NDC support program. To this workshop, held on September 2019, joined representatives from: German Embassy, European Investment Bank, JICA, Canada Embassy, KOICA, French Development Agency, GIZ, Development African Bank, EU and FAOThis document was presented and discussed in spetmeber 2019 with technical and financial stakeholders inorder .
1.2 ToRs of the mission related to the elaboration of the Partnership Plan for the NDC implementation were drafted. Preparatory meetings have been held with the national focal point for climate change, NDC Partnership Plan and the sectors most concerned to clmate change action in Tunisia (energy, coastal and agriculture)
1.4. Partnership program with the parliamentary academy has been initiated and a first information and awareness workshop on climate change has been organized (11 and 12 july 2019), from which about twenty participants benefited between deputies, parliamentary advisers and academy officials.
1.5. - The summary of the NDC implementation roadmap was edited in 500 copies
- Elaboration of a policy note document on climate change in Tunisia (Arabic/French/English) to promote and highlight Tunisias efforts and ambition to face climate change and advocate for technical and financial support in order to meet the investment needs required to achieve NDC. the document was edited (200 copies were prepared)
- The first information and awareness workshop on climate change, organized as part of the partnership program with the parliamentary academy, was covered and a video was prepared accordingly for the two days of training to serve as a educational tool.
3.2 - - The partcipation of 6 members of the national delegation negotiation team to the high-level conference COP 25 (december 2019 at Madrid) was supported in order to reinforce communication on climate change Tunisia experience. These high level team members came respectively from Ministry of Local Affairs and Environment, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Finances) has participated. - Manage all the process of the provision to the Tunisian delegation of an adequate pavilion to facilitate negotiations and meetings of the Tunisian delegation participating in COP25 - Elaboration of a document of priority projects portfolio on climate change (French/English) to present the priority projects that should be implemented with the help of the international community in order to achieve the NDC objectives. - Publication of a special dossier in number of November 2019 in a Tunisian magazine named “LE MANAGER” entitled Climate change, are you ready to disappear ?Otherwise, do business diffrently ! - Publication of an article in number of January 2020 in a Tunisian magazine named “LE MANAGER” entitled COP25 - Tunisian ambitions facing a worlwide disappointment - Organization of press conference (november 29th 2019) to communicate on the the prepration of the Tunisian participation to the COP25

1.1. A partnership plan approved 1.2.
